title: Anivia's Starting Items on HA
body:
Currently, Anivia's starting items on the Howling Abyss are:

{{item:3073}} 850
{{item:1028}} 400
{{item:2003}} x5 250.

This together adds up to 1500, due to the change in Tear of the Goddess's cost (+100). So you're 100 gold short of being able to purchase all of the starting items.



Just thought it should be pointed out so it can be addressed in the future.

ya know, i've been thinking about buying anivia, should i? idk much about her

Shes a difficult champ to play because she needs a ton of set up to get damage off and with all the mobility in this game to dodge her shit and her being immobile, its pretty rough for her especially early. However, if you CAN get a proper set up without being blown up then she can be very annoying to face.

Strengths: Best wave clear for offensive and defensive, damage, CC, good passive, high play making potential, IMO one of the best siege champions, great mid game and heavily complements other team mates CC. 

Weaknesses: Biggest mana whore in this game, weak as fuck early game, immobile, slowest skillshot in game(either that or tf Q), mobility champs negate Q,W and R, heavily relies on team for either follow up or setting up and very squish almost as squish as sona.
You left off her model is larger than most low hp champs so not only is she the slowest, she's got a fat ass that's easy to hit.

Weak early game? Have you ever eaten an Anivia QE at level 2? shit hurts
Tear isn't necessary on Anivia until level 6.
If you're getting Tear, you should never delay it, since you need to stack it up for it to be worth its price.

She stacks it super slow from levels 1-5 since she has no CD and somewhat lengthy CDs. Additionally Lost Chapter gives you much better mana sustain pre-6  as far as ARAM goes. Also with how fast a completed Archangels stacks, it doesn't hurt too much to delay a tear until your 2nd buy or even after RoA.
Just don't buy 5 pots then lol
This.  Just get 3 pots and you are good.
Everybody's first buy is crappy/weird in Howling Abyss, just buy fewer health pots? You don't NEED five, the item was nerfed for a reason and HA isn't specifically balanced for.
To add onto this, anyone who has {{item:3802}} as a recommended starting item on HA are also 200g short of buying boot that the build recommends buying alongside Lost Chapter.

Most people build RoA on Anivia, which makes her not so squishy. She's also extremely hard to get to due to her zoning, slows, and passive. She can be pretty bad to play as if you don't know how to play her, but if you do, it's 10x worse for the enemy.
